english: My father is hunting for deer.

shmalgyack: Geegsh Dzon shu aad dm hoyt hla aadmhoant
english: John bought a new net for fishing.
We will fish with a net today.
The rope is long enough.
The path by your house is straight.

shmalgyack: Ndahl wil 'dahla aah? Where do the edible root plants grow?

english: The old timers were very courageous.
I'm feeling good.
The King salmon was of a good size.

shmalgyack: Naahl en dsaba aamhalaayt hoysh Dan? Who made the headdress that Dan is wearing?

english: The plank is the right length.
There's enough food here.
I will eat after awhile.
I heard the owl at night.
I remember how good deer meat tastes.
I got stung by a bee.
It's not good that you're so anxious.
A few people came.

shmalgyack: Ada weehowtga hana'ack hlat nee wil badsga boad
english: And the woman cried when she saw the boat arrive.
I see that the fire in the water is very bright.

shmalgyack: Wilaaysh Silas adaawck, aam shm ama amookshn
english: Silas knows stories, it's good to really listen.
The butterfly is very red.

shmalgyack: Goayu adaggan? What is ghost bread?

english: I'm afraid of spiders.
My heart is proud.
Henry's house is in the distance.
My great grandchildren will soon be here.

shmalgyack: Ahl aamdee maay gwa'a? Is this fruit good?
Ahlgadee aam wila how sha'winshga gwa'a
english: What this paper says is not good.

shmalgyack: Ahlgadee goahl geegee I bought nothing

english: What the man said was not clear.
I saw a lot of hummingbirds where we camped.
She misbuttoned her blouse.

shmalgyack: Aygyadid maata awil amaneedsda goa gubt
english: Martha lived a very long life because she was careful about what she ate.
The sack was pretty light.

shmalgyack: Nda shgaboo daala aishken? How much money do you owe?

english: I want fried bread.
I like fried fish best.
This water is bitter.
There was a lot of wet snow yesterday.
There will be more deer this year.

shmalgyack: Dm dawhla boad dsihla akshyaagwa dseewsh
english: The boat will leave at dawn.
I don't see any smoke coming from the chimney.
Don't be lazy.

shmalgyack: Na dm badsu 'wee ggan gwee dowl ggal alashkwu, hlgookshnt
english: I was going to pick up a big wood but I was too weak and I couldn't.

shmalgyack: Alda hoy gyad hlat dsaba waab
english: People use fir to build a house.

shmalgyack: Aam wila how liplaid hla algyackd
english: The preacher sounds good when he speaks.
There are nobles in every village.
Mary was full of praise for her son.

shmalgyack: Amadsaba wila waal goa dm wila gyoayu
english: What I do will be well designed.
I like the way that man is very kind.
Be careful of where you walk.
Happy New Year.
I'm not wealthy yet.
Dan is very handsome.

shmalgyack: Goahl wilsh ameelga hoyan? What mask are you wearing?

english: There are a lot of black ducks where we camped.

shmalgyack: Amggan hoy gyad hlat dsaba p'tsaan
english: People use red cedar to make a totem pole.
Debbie's voice is beautiful when she sings.
Listen when the Chief speaks.
Put the chair in the corner of the house.
I used cottonwood in the smokehouse.
My skin is itchy.
I am buying some bread for my mom.
The tree branch broke during the strong wind.
I give you permission to go to the store.
She didn't let the cat come in.
My arm is aching.
The salt container is empty.
I am eating soapberries.
I made a mistake when I bought a new car.
Nee gyad wila gyoan. Don't make mistakes. People see what you're doing.
I foot hurts.
The little dog was funny.
Good grief! That man is really a chatterbox.

shmalgyack: Gilmt nabeebu ashwn da 'koy ada lu'kwil 'tsamaatgt
english: My uncle gave me sea urchin and it was very tasty.

shmalgyack: 'Daan da lack ha'li'daa da awaa likshoack
english: Sit on the chair by the door.
Put the table there.
Her mother said, why?

shmalgyack: 'Yagayaayu da geeka, 'waa wil awsh, da 'nee nwil giguul gaboack
english: I went down the beach, found sand, that's where I looked for cockles.
I haven't seen a porcupine.

shmalgyack: Awul gushga gganaow a lack guyna
english: The frog jumped away from the road.
I'm going to put the fish aside.

shmalgyack: Ayaawgga Shm'oygit da wila waal shahoan
english: The Chief gave an official statement about the fishing.
Pitch the ball.
The car is almost there.
The boat is almost here.
The child cried out when he saw me.
ahlgadee hashacku uushgmlaan. No. I don't want stink eggs.

shmalgyack: Ayow! Daya gyad hlat nee wil gusha hoan
english: aYOW! That's what people say when they see fish jump.

shmalgyack: Wie aam dm aytga na waam 'Tsmshiant
english: It is time to call her by her 'TsmSHIAN name.

shmalgyack: Lu'kwil a'waa'ackshga 'yoota gwee dumt wilaay dm hadiksh
english: That man is working hard to learn how to swim.

shmalgyack: Baa hlgu hash hla hashackt dm galmeelgt
english: The little dog runs when it wants to play.

shmalgyack: Ahl sheepga wil baahlgn? Does it hurt where you got operated?
Baaldu ndm guba shameeym ol - ahlgandee anoackt
english: I tried to eat bear meat - I don't like it.
I'm afraid to see a ghost.
The cat was afraid when it saw the dog.
The wind is strong when the moon is full.
Don't be anxious, wait for me.
I tasted bear meat - I don't like it.
There was a strong gale yesterday.

shmalgyack: Dm backyaam da awaa lack 'daa dm guul maay
english: We're going to walk up to the lake to gather berries.

shmalgyack: Badsa ha'li'daa ada 'dooshgn da na hluut
english: Lift the chair and sweep under it.

shmalgyack: Hla badsga 'yoota gwee dowl awaayu wil goyt
english: The man arrived and came to me.

shmalgyack: Baloasha hoyu hlan guba ai'dsum anaay
english: I use syrup when I eat fried bread.

shmalgyack: Sheepga banu hlan guba ggal hailda anaay
english: My tummy hurts when I eat too much bread.

shmalgyack: Bana hoy gyad wil hailda hoan
english: People use a dip net when there are lots of fish.
Divide up the seaweed on the rock.
I'm not able to tear the bark from the tree.
We have to gather cedar bark tomorrow.

shmalgyack: Needsu ba'an da awaa waab shgool
english: I saw your father by the school.
My uncle is hunting for grouse.
Don't lie.
That star is very bright.

shmalgyack: Ha'weenhl needsinee beyaalshm aatk? Haven't you seen the evening star?
Ha'weenhl needsinee beyaalshm gganhlaag? Haven't you seen the morning star?

english: The meadowlark makes pretty music.
I want a new belt.

shmalgyack: Ggal hailda gyada en guguul bilha
english: Too many people are searching for abalone.
Chop up this wood, it's too big.
I was dizzy when I looked down the cliff.

shmalgyack: Dm kshagyoatguu da Ta'gwaan da 'dsm boad
english: I am going to Metlakatla by boat.
Don't let the water splash.
Look for my boots.

shmalgyack: Ahlgandee bishboosha lag awil 'gwaatga na gigyoatgu
english: I didn't chop the wood because my axe is lost.
The child waited for his mother.
Hla goidiksha 'dsig'dsig, aam boo'ishgn. Be careful where you walk. The car's going to come, you should get out of the way.

shmalgyack: Nda bou'ish da Macklackaahla? Where are the monkeys in Metlakatla?

english: The slave cleaned the house.
Decayed food smells bad.

shmalgyack: Aam guba ckaldaawckga 'gilmsh noan, sha damoatgn
english: It's good to eat the medicine your mother gave you, it will save you.

shmalgyack: Ahl needsinee wil 'tsuu ckaygg da hahl-geeka? Have you see where there's a lot of foam down the beach?

english: I heard that the west wind will be strong tomorrow.

shmalgyack: Ha'weenhl ckbaickshgt George taggan? Hasn't George sawed the planks yet?
Geedsa ckbashm 'ka'kackda ckshoa da wil 'tsuu baashg
english: The canoe almost turned upside down because of the strong wind.
Open the bigger box.
The man delivered information about the arrival of the ooligans.

shmalgyack: Na goo wunu ashda 'guulda sha, goo wun, da 'gilmu ckbeeyay da hlguyu
english: I went hunting one day, shot the deer, and I gave half of it to my children.
People bow their heads when they pray.

shmalgyack: Aba'ackshgu dm wil yaa maadm awil lu'kwil anoacku ckdaiksh
english: I'm anxious for the snow to fall because I really like Indian ice cream.

shmalgyack: Dm ckdeeym wilaayshgm dsihla Ha'li Shgwaitga sha
english: We're going to eat with our relatives on Sunday.

shmalgyack: Hagwil baa boad da wil ckdsee yain
english: The boat ran slowly when the fog was thick.

shmalgyack: Ahlgandee neehl ckdso'otsk shga 'naga wil ggaldsockm
english: I haven't seen a hawk since we've been at our camp.
Elderly people really feel cold.
Let's eat fish.
The woman got anxious when the ball burst.

shmalgyack: Ayinhl dm cklggoant 'need? Aren't you going to pay him?
Naahl dm en cklggoam da ckshoa? Who will pay us for the canoe?

english: We need to kill all of the mosquito larvae.
I disagree with what that man said.
It's not good for people to gamble.

shmalgyack: Dsida ahlgadee ayaaltgn, ahlga dm ckshdaan
english: If you're not lucky you won't win.
The gun made a very loud noise.
The child vomited from crying too long.
There are lots of eagles where we are.
The man whistled when he saw a beautiful woman.

shmalgyack: Ggal giamga waab, 'nee gun geedsa cksh'docku
english: The house was too warm, that's why I almost fell asleep.
Oh boy! The herring eggs that people gave us tastes very good
It's not good for people to smoke.
Dear Miss, I'm really going to listen to you.
Don't lose your money.

shmalgyack: Shm ama 'daa hlguwoamhlg hlat daalckat noat
english: The child sat still when his mother scolded him.

shmalgyack: Geedsa daamshacka hana'ack hlat nee shgaboo daala
english: The woman almost fainted when she saw how much money there was.
Da'ackhlgm dm sha daaw wineayam. We're lucky today. We are able to freeze our food.

shmalgyack: 'Guulda waalm da 'nak doashda, dat Peter Fawcett, Peter Wesley 'nahowyu, dsaba daayksh da 'kam, da up oa, wilaay 'yoota gwee dsabt
english: This is one thing we did, Peter Fawcett, I mean Peter Wesley, made Indian ice cream, and oh boy, that man really knew how to make it.
White men like flounder.

shmalgyack: Dackshmhietga hlgu hash hlat tcka'noo wil ckshwa'dackga 'yoota
english: The dog stood still when he heard the man's whistle.

shmalgyack: Shguu dm dackshm'daan ada amookshn da wil howsh noan
english: You should sit still and listen to what your mother has to say.
Hold the rope tight.
Labiet shoonsha'nu. Take a hold of my arms. I'm blind.
Lead me.
Tie the rope around the box.
Those dogs are going to fight.

shmalgyack: Dalbikshga hoaya dsida ggal giamga aksh
english: The clothes shrink if the water's too warm.
The plank I cut is too short.
I'm not going to cut the short trees.
Peter hugged his dog when it was found.
My clothes line is tight.
I'm going to give my friend a flower.
It's good to save our language.
Don't squeeze the fish.
We put the fish on the fern (leaves).
We're going to judge Larry.
I want a new whet stone.

shmalgyack: Ahlgandee gubhl daway, 'nee gn ahlgandee wilaayhl goahl dm wil howyu da gwa'a
english: I've never eaten goat, that's why I don't know what to say about it.

shmalgyack: Sha gya'win dm wil dawhlsh Dzon da Macklackaahla
english: John will leave for Metlakatla today.

shmalgyack: Ndahl dm wil daawhln da Gitsgaan? When are you going away to Ketchikan?

english: I am able to make a dog house.
I'm giving fish to my aunt.

shmalgyack: Ahl 'waayanee da'ka'aaw? Have you found any sea anemone?

english: I want to poke your little cheeks.

shmalgyack: Wiedsa dp debaa boad ada gwin daawhlm da Gitsgaan
english: Lets run away with the boat and go over to Ketchikan.
His dancing was done with poise.
The halo around the moon is amazing.
Don't play compulsively with your hair.

shmalgyack: Lack dee awaan wil wun wun
english: The deer can be found on the hill there.

shmalgyack: Goahl gn ahlgadee deelumckgt? Why didn't she answer?
Dm gwindaawhlm da Gitsgaan dsihla deetck'aksh
english: We'll go over to Ketchikan when the tide is high.

shmalgyack: Ha'weenhl de'kwun moalksh? Aren't the crabapple ripe yet?
Na ggalmeelgm da lack geeka dowl dsaggabaa hlgu diboygid
english: We were playing down on the beach when a little mouse ran across.
I own a lot of shoes.
The young man is still alive.

shmalgyack: Hla goamshm dihl magwa'ala dihl goaym
english: In the early winter, the late winter, and in the spring.
That old cedar stump is still standing.

shmalgyack: Di'deelda hahlalsha'nm hla hashackum dm meelgm
english: We do things faster when we want to dance.
There are a lot of wolves across the way.
The child is spoiled, that's why she cries a long time.
We have to take wood.

shmalgyack: Shguu mdm dockdocka hagwilhoo dsihla 'dsuu baashg
english: You have to hold on to the rope when the wind blows hard.
Martha makes beautiful cedar bark baskets.

shmalgyack: Ahlgandee wilaayhl goahl gn geetga na doolayu
english: I don't know why my tongue is swollen.

shmalgyack: Doolckga'nu da Gitsgaan da wil haackga lacka
english: I got stuck in Ketchikan when the weather was bad.
I see a dog and a cat.
We've never seen a tiger.
Dress warm, it's cold outside.

shmalgyack: Doyksha aksh da awaa 'wee loaba gwee
english: The rapids are strong by that big rock.
I use jam on my bread.

shmalgyack: Goadu ap dee dsabn? What work do you do?

english: Let's go hunting tonight.
The deer died.

shmalgyack: 'Tsuu dsaggabaashg da lackshuulda The cross wind was very strong on the ocean
Dsagga-tgubaa hash hlat shuwileen hlgu doosh
english: The dog ran in a circle when it chased the little cat.
I'm going to walk across to the store.
I made it across the big street.
They will return to shore.
The canoe will be going towards shore.

shmalgyack: Ahl ggatgyadee dsagmwaash? Is the south wind strong?

english: I finished all the food that's why I'm full.
Dampen the clothes before you iron them.
I don't want an old fish.
I'm going to boil an egg.
'Nee hoym da anaay. My wife knows how to fix laughing berries. That's what we have on bread.
Our traps are lost.
I don't like gray berries.

shmalgyack: Ahlgadee aam dm dsa'bl hahlibeeshk, ahlgadee aam da 'kwan
english: It's not good to play with a knife, it's not good for you.
Good grief! Watch what you're doing.
The ice melts when it's too warm.
Snipe is a little bird.
Put the box in the corner of the closet.
The man over there brags too much.
The men stood still when the Chief spoke.
The child is humorous when he struts her stuff.
Don't strut your stuff.
Bail the boat out.
The sun will melt the ice.
We'll leave at daylight.
I haven't swam with a porpoise

shmalgyack: Dse ndahl dm goidiksha boad? When is the boat coming?

english: Martha is my grandmother.
I'm going to my grandmother's house.
We'll leave tomorrow.
We'll eat at the time the food is done.
We're going to harvest sea urchins.
His face is red when he's ashamed.
I'm going to hunt for squirrel tomorrow.
Lots of fish died.
We have to paddle the canoe.
Oh! I wish I could have some.
The man's beard is long.

shmalgyack: Lugowdee ggalm eeshu, shgu ndm gik geegt
english: My container of yeast is empty, I need to buy it again.
Take the box and give it to your mother.
The Nass River people speak another language.
I'm going to cook some cabbage.
The child plays a long time.
I am eating carrots.
Don't depart - the wind is too strong.

shmalgyack: Lu'kwil kwdee 'yoota gwee 'neegn lugawdee na giehld
english: That man was very hungry that's why his dish is empty.
I agreed when I heard what he said.
I almost fell down.

shmalgyack: Hailda geek da lack geeka da 'yagayaayu ndm 'kots'kots
english: Dm hoyu da na waabu dm sha gyamga waabu. There are lots of hemlock down the beach so I'm going to walk down there and cut them up. I use it to warm up my house.
We're digging clams next to the water.

shmalgyack: Hla gawdee tckaoackga gyad - geemga ha'litckoackg
english: The people are done eating - wipe the table.
Hla kwdeeyu. Well, give me the bread. I'm hungry.
She made a mistake when sewing the blanket.
I wasn't able to dodge the ball.

shmalgyack: Geetga an'onu ada ahlgadee da'acklgu ndm hoy gwishgwashm on'onu My hand is swollen and I can't wear my rings

english: The lake is flooding.

shmalgyack: Nee wil ggusha 'wee ggaagg da gyalck
english: See the big raven jumping outside.
The rope I'm using is strong.

shmalgyack: Ggaapcka doosha likshoack hla hashact dm 'dseent
english: The cat scratched the door when it wanted to come in.
Rake the coals up in the stove.
I jumped when the man yelled in a loud voice.
Let's gather some cockles.
Throw out the anchor.

shmalgyack: Naahl en ggadeeshga na ggawshn? Who braided your hair?

english: Ggal hailda hoan wila waald. See that big humpback salmon. There's lots of fish where it is.

shmalgyack: Hida ggadsaagg wila dsaba taggan da lack waab
english: The lumber on the house looked like a cross.

shmalgyack: Shuulga wila dsaba lacka hla ggadsiksha waash
english: The sky looks fearful when the rain pours down.

shmalgyack: Giloamdsa 'kotsa kyoack awil ggal ggadsikshga waash
english: Don't cut the grass because the rain is pouring.
The little boy has long fingers.
I haven't seen a swan.

shmalgyack: Nda shgaboo ggaggawsha wun? How many antlers does the deer have?
Ha'weenhl backanee ggaggoackm hoan? Haven't you tasted fish nose yet?
Na guguuldm ggagoom da lack loab da wil 'ken hlumad da ahlgadee ap 'waad
english: We looked for seagulls on the rock to find the eggs but couldn't find any.
The dog laid on his side when he was done eating.
I'm going to walk up in the woods.
I'm going to string up the fish.
Put the meat on sticks so it will dry.
The woman is wearing beautiful beads.
My hat is too big.
Some mushrooms are not good.
I don't like the rimmed hat you're wearing.
The boy forgot his rain hat.
My grandmother made many yarn hats.
I'm going to give my husband a cap.
Watch out for dead tree branches.
The child crept along when he was angry.

shmalgyack: Shguu mdm kshi ggaimggan 'daa'binshg da ggan
english: You have to pry the nails out of the wood.
Don't forget the oars.
The skunk is stink.
I'm afraid to see a rat.
The dance just started.
When everyone was in, that's when they started.

shmalgyack: Ggakshwil a'aamta hana'ack hla wil gigeengwackhla gyad
english: The woman got better after the people prayed.
Hashacku ndm shilahown. Come here. I want to talk with you.

shmalgyack: Ggalaaga hlgumadm ggaguum da lack kyoack
english: The seagull egg cracked on the grass.

shmalgyack: Ndahl dm wil 'wayy ggalaaw? Where will we find the red cedar trees?

english: Two canoes have arrived.
The basket was empty.
Wash the container you used for eating.
I'm going by boat to the store.
Bring the bucket with you.
I really like this camp.
Metlakatla is the village where I'm from.
I'm going to go camping this summer.

shmalgyack: Shmhow na ggaleemksha Shm'oygit ga Lackaga
english: God's word is the truth.

shmalgyack: Goahl gun ggalgwai'hla gwa'a? Why is this sack empty?

english: There are too many people in the boat.

shmalgyack: Wee howtga hlguwoamhlg hlat tcka'noo ggalipleep
english: The child cried when she heard the thunder.
The child jumped for a long time outside.

shmalgyack: Naayu na ggalm'algyacka Shm'oygit? Who is the Chief's spokesperson?
Hashacka 'yoota dumt sha 'kotsa ggalooy da an'ont
english: The man wants to cut the wart off his arm.
I want dried cockles.
Come! It's time to eat.
Come! We're going to sing.

shmalgyack: Ggaltsggan taggan dm geegu ndm ama dsaba guyna
english: I'm going to buy three planks to fix the street.
I see three canoes.
The man claims too much.
Ggoadu ggal 'naga da yaayu ashda gi'dseeb. My knee hurts. I think it's because I walked too long yesterday.
I almost dropped the box because it was very heavy.
My stomach hurts.
Your hat is too small.

shmalgyack: Ggal'uunck na dee hoy gyad hla 'nag hlat damoatga na wineayat
english: People used Indian boxes long ago to save their food.
He should not go there because he is unlucky.

shmalgyack: Na 'yagayaam da moolaa laa da hailda ggamckbaickshg, da 'nee hoym da lack yuubm
english: I went down to the sawmill where there was a lot of sawdust and that's what we used on our ground.
Close the door.
I use shavings to turn the wood.
I don't want to buy cheap things.
I'm going to burn the sweepings.
People use charcoal when they paint.
I'm going to take good care of that tree.

shmalgyack: Oa, hla gganahietgu da waaba gwa'a, hla geedsa shonaahlu
english: Yes, I leaned against this house, when I almost got tired.
I heard a frog by the lake.
I saw the backpack in the back room.
Robert is the youngest male.
Gather more pieces of wood.
I cut up kindling every morning.
Ruther's father is Raven.
My father went fishing this morning.

shmalgyack: Shgu dm hoym gganhlaan da lack ha'liwildoolgit
english: We need to wear body armor when we go onto the battlefield.
All the clothes pins are gone.
I'm going to sit by the window.

shmalgyack: Geedsa ggantka ggaidu awil lu'kwil gwatka lacka
english: My hat almost dried hard because the weather was so cold.
His things look very cheap.
Put the oar in the oar lock.

shmalgyack: Dm geegu shu gganyishya'tsa da nakshu
english: I'm going to buy new suspenders for my spouse.

shmalgyack: Ahl shguuhl ggan'dameesh da 'kwan? Do you have a pencil?

english: Give me the safety pin.
That man doesn't blink.
My skin is rough because of the strong wind.

shmalgyack: Nda ggashggaw ha'li-tckoackga dm dsabm? How big is the table that we're going to make?
Ahl dee 'tsamaa'anee ggashggaads? Do you like the taste of dogfish?

english: The boy's feet were hurt when he jumped.
The man is really strong.
There was a strong gale yesterday.

shmalgyack: Ggawaaym 'tu'utsga hoy hlaagi gyad hla dildalt
english: People in the old times used a sword to fight.
Completely chew up what you eat.

shmalgyack: Nahl en ggadeeshga na ggawshn? Who braided your hair?

english: His/her chest hurts.
There's a lot of dog salmon by Metlakatla.
I use a gun when I shoot deer.
There are mosquito larvae in the barrel.
Pull down the window.

shmalgyack: Needsu wil gga'dsihl'doosha hoguwoamhlg na hlmkdeet
english: I saw the child push his brother down.

shmalgyack: Geedsa gga'dsihl'oksha ggan da wil ggal 'balgiackshga maadm
english: The tree almost fell down because the snow was too heavy.
The child slid on the ice.
There are a lot of Europeans living in Ketchikan.
Don't be a worthless person.
The eagle has long wings.
The salmon berry bush doesn't grow here.
The man howled when he heard the wolf.
I shiver when I'm cold.

shmalgyack: Kshi'nag de hoyu hla lu 'dsaicka wineaya da ggiehlu
english: I use my middle finger when I lick out my bowl.
My wife uses an iron dish when she cooks.
There are lots of waves when the wind is strong.
That man is very kind.
It's good to cool the water down.
Bow your head under the flag.
John's house tumbled down.

shmalgyack: Ha'weenhl needsinee ggol'ge? Haven't you seen the yellow berries on the muskeg?
Lu'kwil amookshu da wila how 'yoota gwee da up ahlga ggontgahla wila howd
english: I really listened to what that man said but it's not clear what he said.
Look where the fish jumps.
There are many wolves on that island.

shmalgyack: Alik dm gigeengwackhlt nagoaga dm sha'daa'amum
english: Alec will pray before we start.
That woman has blond hair.

shmalgyack: Gigi'oashga hoguwoamhlg hlat how noat dm yaawcktgt
english: The child was stubborn when the mother said to eat.

shmalgyack: Na waaym da wite gwashga da goa 'wee loagsh, aam shga'nag dowla gigyoaksht dowla awaa Ta'gwaan habm
english: We rowed way over there to get a log, after a while it floated then we went to Metlakatla.
I lost my hatchet.
Say it again.
You will stand in the stern.
Some of the dragon flies are very big.

shmalgyack: Nee wila loa 'guba gilakyo, yagwa sha laaldid
english: Look what the little robins are doing, they're gathering worms.
'Nee dm goym da gganhlaag. We're going to collect berries up in the woods.
Take care of yourself, that's what my grandmother said to me.

shmalgyack: Gilksh-shamacksha nagwaada hlguwoamhlg awil dm didoolsht
english: The child's father was willing to die so that his child might live.
The picture the man made is beautiful.

shmalgyack: Gilksh'ietksha hlguwoamhlg awilt oy loab da 'nakshuuneeshg
english: The child was sorry that he threw a rock at the window.
Don't throw the rocks.
Gil'akshe. Well, fellow. Give me a drink of water.
There are a lot of things left over.
People showed up unexpectedly where we live.
Peter stayed behind because the weather was bad.

shmalgyack: Ahlga dm gipaiga'nu da sha gya'wn
english: We're not going to fly today.
The People of the Elderberries have arrived at our village.
I belong to the Killer Whale Clan.
Help me move the table over.
There's a northeasterly blowing.

shmalgyack: Ap shm luguuye gishiyaashg wil wuwaalm
english: The north wind is really blowing where we are.
Move over by me.
My uncle passed away some time ago.
People of the Shrubs have invited all of us.
People of the Salmon Traps make good ooligan grease.
There are a lot of People of Two Passing Canoes.

shmalgyack: Ndahl wil dsoockdu Gitnack'angeek? Where do the people of the Mosquitoes live?

english: Don't give anything to enemy raiders.
I'm going to buy fish eggs from the People of the Kelp.
I haven't met any People of the Other Side.
People of the Way Inside are good fishermen.
The work done by the People of the Swift Waters is beautiful.

shmalgyack: Ahl needsinee boad da wiet giyaaksh? Do you see the boat that's way out on the water?
Nda wila waal lacka ashda gi'dseeb? How was the weather yesterday?

english: The broom is in the back room.
I'll sit in the bow.

shmalgyack: Aa'backdu wila leemee hlaa gigyad ashda wite gi'goahl
english: I remember how the old people used to sing many years ago.

shmalgyack: Goahl wilgyedu gwa'a? What color is this?

english: The rain clouds have made it an overcast day.

shmalgyack: Anoacku dm hahlalshu da gyalck wil goabacka sha
english: I like to work outside when the day is overcast.
The children used small berry baskets to pick berries.

shmalgyack: Nda goadsagid dm hoyu da 'kawtsi? Where's the container I'm going to use for the ooligan grease?

english: The pillow is soft.

shmalgyack: Luaam ggoadu hla daawhla goamshm ada hla badsga goaym
english: I'm happy when the winter leaves and spring arrives.
I'm going to give the child two pencils.

shmalgyack: Aam mdm hoy golksh, hailda geega da gyalck
english: It's good for you to wear a scarf, there are a lot of mosquito's outside.
Don't you shoot a wolf.

shmalgyack: Ndadu gooda'atsn? Where is your coat?
Ndayu na gooda'atsm shgyenu? Where's my raincoat?

english: Alec found gold on the mountain.

shmalgyack: Naahl en guba goomaa? Who eats rat fish?
Lu'kwil 'tsamaatga goowaagg da lack giamgm anaay
english: Elderberry jam is very good on warm bread.
I use two different kinds of eyeglasses.

shmalgyack: Wie ndahl dm dee goyn? Where are you going?
Ndahl dm wil goydikshgt Donna May? When is Donna May coming?

english: The light is too bright.

shmalgyack: Goadu dm gubn? What are you going to eat?

english: I'm looking for salmon berries.

shmalgyack: Alu'daa wil gugwalksha gahooda hlgu hana'ack
english: You can really see how shiny the woman's necklace is.
The dog walked slowly toward me.
I want to find where the fish jump.
The child doesn't want to wake up.

shmalgyack: Na dsaba hlgu hana'ack goa dm gubm, da ahlgadeet wilaay goahl wila gyoad dowla lu'kwil gushcka gubm
english: The little girl was cooking what we were going to eat and didn't know what she was doing so what we ate was bitter.

shmalgyack: Ahlgandee wilaayhl goa dm wila gyoayu dun guudacka n'dse'etsu goa dm wila gyoayu
english: I didn't know what to do so I asked my grandmother what to do.

shmalgyack: Wie dm guul maay sha gya'wn
english: Hla hailda mikmeegt. Well, we're going to pick berries today. A lot are ripe.
There are a lot of waves when the westerly wind blows.
The clothes will soon be dry.

shmalgyack: Hashackanee guunkshm hoan? Do you want dried fish?

english: Follow the trail to the next village.
The food is done.
Don't touch the window.

shmalgyack: Ahlgadee aam dm gwaashgn dish ligit naa
english: It's not good to borrow from anybody.

shmalgyack: Sha hailda gwai'hla gyad, 'nee hoym hla sha hla'ashgm
english: We have lots of sacks, that's what we use when we gather seaweed.
The fire is burning.

shmalgyack: Ha'wahlgandee nee wil gwalka gyad na ggawsht
english: I haven't seen people trim their hair by burning the ends.

shmalgyack: Wie hla aam dm gwal'kan laakwsh
english: Well it's good to the lights on.
Peter gave us three fish.
Well, we'll go over there.
I'm afraid of pigs.
The day is cold.
That house is pitiful.
Sit right here.

shmalgyack: Naa an'on da gwee? Whose hand is that?
Ha'wahlgandee neehl gweekw, 'nee gun ahlgandee wilaayhl goahl dm wila howyu
english: I've never seen a groundhog, that's why I don't know what to say.
Dm hailda wila gyoam dsidaawhl. Let's get ready. We're going to do a lot of things tonight.
Three people arrived.

shmalgyack: Ahl sheepganee, gwinaat? Are you sick, poor fellow?

english: That man didn't appear for work.

shmalgyack: Hashacku ndm gwinee'dsn shu gooda'atsu da 'kwan
english: I want to show you my new coat.
There's a blue jay in the tree.
I'm going to buy a blue coat.

shmalgyack: Naahl en dsaba gwishgwashm an'on hoyen? Who made the ring that you're wearing?
Hashacksh dup gwee dumt dsaba gwish-halayt
english: They want to make a robe for dancing.

shmalgyack: Dm kshagaadu na gwishmateeyu dsihla 'dsuuhl gwatg
english: I'm going to get out my mountain goat skin coat when it gets really cold.
There's a little fawn walking on the beach.
He/she is sewing a button blanket.

shmalgyack: Ahl tckanooyanee gwitgwineeksh? Do you hear the owl?

english: Draw water for her.
The whale came out of the water.

shmalgyack: Ndada tckash 'goahl wil goo gyada wun? What part of the year do people shoot deer?

english: Ggal lu giamga 'tsawaab. We'll go outside. It's too warm in the house.
This house is too warm.

shmalgyack: Hashacku dm gukshgu nagoacka dm kshagwaantga gyamgmdseewsh
english: I want to wake up before the sun comes up.
The moon will be full tonight.
The young men are gathering sea cucumber.

shmalgyack: Mun gya'galtga sha'winshk and lu oyt da 'dsm shdoob
english: Roll up the paper and throw it in the stove.

shmalgyack: Ahlgadee aam lacka da sha gya'wn
english: The weather is not good today.
Everett speared the fish in the river.
The wind is calm now.
I feel it when you are sad.
He is picking mussels.

shmalgyack: Ndahl wil 'waay gyad gyem? Where do people find Saskatoon berries?

english: Seagull eggs will be found up high.
I like herring eggs on the flat kelp.

shmalgyack: Ahlga 'dahla gyuwadun da gwa'a, ksha geeka wil 'dahlt
english: There are no horses here, just down below.
It's not easy for me to do it.

shmalgyack: Na labiethow na gyadu, dowla haada labiet waald, dsabtda doctor
english: My intestine was bad and the doctor fixed it.
Some people like the intestine of the seal.
Hang the picture on the wall.
I like the color of the fireweed.

shmalgyack: Ahlgadee hashacku dm haaya na boadu
english: I don't want my boat to rot.
Take good care of what people give you.
Get the things ready that we're going to sell.
I need to sharpen my pocket knife.
Give me the saw.

shmalgyack: Goahl wilsh hackdek dm hoyu? What tool shall I use?

english: Pass the pipe around.

shmalgyack: Labite hlgookshn dm daayu da boad, labite waal na hadaayu
english: I wasn't able to steer the boat, my steering wheel went out.
I like to sew.

shmalgyack: Lu'kwil hashacku dm hadikshu dsihla shuunt
english: I really want to swim when summer is here.
He died from syphilis.
Say it again - the car was too loud.
Your singing is beautiful, do it again.
I have to wash the dish towels.

shmalgyack: Noayu en dsaba na hoyayu, hoy haggagietk dumt 'kotsa dm hoyt
english: My mother made my clothes, she used scissors to cut what she used.
The man walked slowly because his stomach hurt.

shmalgyack: Wie 'dsuu hagwilhoo, 'nee dm hoyu hla oom hoanu
english: Well, the rope is strong, it's what I use to go fishing.
Eat slowly.
The man walked slowly because his stomach hurt.

shmalgyack: Hagwilya'dsa hashoicka waab dsuds wil dsaga gyad
english: The bell rings slowly at the church when someone dies.
'Nee guulm hla geeka aksh. Oh boy! The horse mussel tastes very good. That's what we get when the tide is low.
I have to repair the keel.
The woman worked hard when she cleaned the house.

shmalgyack: Hahldoa loagakshgm hoaya da awaa lag
english: Put the soaked clothes by the fire.
Take the wood along the beach.
I'll meet you on the beach.
Dm sha shackanu. Give me the knife. I'm going to sharpen it.

shmalgyack: Dm kshagyoatgu da Ta'gwaan da 'dsm hahloamboad
english: I am going to Metlakatla by sailboat.
We have a flag.

shmalgyack: Ama doa ckbeesh da hahlwaal 'kala aksh
english: Put the boxes nicely along the beach.
Let's walk along the beach of the river.

shmalgyack: 'Tsamaatga hoan na hahlyaagwda gyad da awaa lag
english: Fish whose skins are roasted by the fire taste good.
People are saying that the ooligans have arrived.

shmalgyack: Dm haickalan mdm wila da'ackhlga goa hashackan
english: You have to be persistent, then you will get what you want.
They smell like smoke.
I know there's lots of fruit.

shmalgyack: Ha'weenhl backanee yoam hakk? Haven't you tasted roasted goose?

english: Sing again, it sounded good.
Devil's club is good medicine.
Treat his hand with medicine where it is burned.
People are afraid of witchcraft.
Bring up the door.
The woman got up when she heard the boat.

shmalgyack: 'Wee amhown dish maata - shguu dm haldm'acklgt
english: Holler at Martha - she has to get up.

shmalgyack: Haldm'oy nakshn, hladm laaltgd da hahlalsht
english: Wake up your husband, he'll be late for work.
Kayla is learning to play the piano.
Mary is bothered when the man shouts.

shmalgyack: Ndayu na hlguhlgm hana'ackn? Where is your little girl?
Hapckdooweew dsaba gyad da ggan, 'nee hoym hla tckoackgm
english: People made horn spoons out of wood, that's what we use when we eat.
I am carving a spoon.

shmalgyack: Hashacku ndm geega hapshgoulgm ggan dsabn
english: I want to buy the wooden spoon you made.
Clean your comb.
I want deer meat.

shmalgyack: Ggal geetga hashdalksha hana'ack dumt hoy gwishgwashm an'ont
english: The woman's ring finger is too swollen to wear her ring.
I'm worried that I might catch a sickness.

shmalgyack: Hashooshga ligi goa waal hlgu 'yoota gwee
english: Whatever that boy does seems to cause trouble.
Ring the bell when you want me.
The potatoes are boiling.
Joe made an arrow.

shmalgyack: Goahl wilsh hawala'awa dm gaadn? What weapon are you going to take?
Ha'weenhl needsinee hawhaw? Haven't you seen a lion?

english: I like the length of the fork you're using.
I have my own dipper.
The child's sneeze is funny.
This stump is too big.
The lid to the coffee pot is lost.
The weather is bad.
Syphilis is not good.
Jack gave her cedar bark.
Put the broom away.

shmalgyack: Ndahl wil shguhl ha'dseekwsha? Where is the wooden brailer?
Aam dsa ap ha'dsinaasha shuunta gwa'a
english: It will be nice to have good luck this summer.

shmalgyack: Ahl ha'dsiyaanee da sha gya'wn? Do you feel lucky today?
Ama nee wila yaan, hailda ha'dsi'uult da gwa'a
english: Watch where you walk, there are lots of snails here.
Give me that seal club.
The clubs used by people in the past were dreaded.
Rub my back.
Put the chair by the window.
We're going to use sheets for drying the seaweed.

shmalgyack: Na dsaba nagwaadu waab adat hoy ha'lickbaickshg
english: My father built a house and he used a sawhorse.

shmalgyack: Goayu ha'lidalshm? What are you fighting over?

english: I want peace on the earth.
Well, we'll fix up the playground.

shmalgyack: Ahl 'nee dee ha'liggoadn? Is that what you think too?

english: Today is Tuesday.
Today is Friday.
I really like the altar that the people made.
I think the shoes are under the bed.

shmalgyack: Ha'li Shgwaitg dowl ggadsudsm, dowl leemeeym da 'dsm na Waabsh Shm'oygit ga Lackaga
english: On Sunday we go to church and sing the Lord's house.

shmalgyack: Dm gwindaawhl da Gitsgaan dsihla Ha'li tckaalpcka Sha
english: I'm going over to Ketchikan on Thursday.
There's lots of food on the table.
Put your books on the shelf.
The cabinet is in the dining room.

shmalgyack: Dm 'daayu da lack ha'liwaalcksh I'm going to sit on the floor
Ha'wahlgandee nee ha'liwildoolgit shawaadida Viet Nam
english: I haven't seen the battleground that's called Viet Nam.

shmalgyack: Hla Hali yaygg dowla Gitsgaan habn, dm geegu wineaya
english: On Saturday we go to Kethikan to buy food.
My mother wants a chair.
Put the box on the table.

shmalgyack: Lu amaam ggaggoada gyad da hla ha'li'doygg
english: People are happy on the day to greet people.
Martha made a good place to fillet fish.
This is Monday.

shmalgyack: Ndm tckal'waayn da waab tckoackg dsihla Hali'Gwilee Sha
english: I'll meet you at the restaurant on Wednesday.
Doreen knows how to fry devilfish.
They haven't arrived yet.

shmalgyack: 'Ka ha'weeni, ndm hlimoamn! Wait a minute, I'll help you!
'Dsuu hlgu hieda 'yoota gwa'a da'al aam wila Shm'algyackt
english: This young man is Haida but he speaks good 'TsmSHIAN language.
I want to know the Haida language, too.
Send the box to John.

shmalgyack: Ama hietga ggadsaagg da lack yuub
english: The cross stands good on the ground.

shmalgyack: Giloamdsa 'goa'olda gooda'atsm shgyan dsihla gwaantga hiwaash
english: Don't forget your raincoat when the southeast wind starts.
The old people are meeting together.
The crab's claws are fearsome.
Your toenails are too long.
Your fingernails are a pretty color.
I have to buy a new carving knife.
That ball is too big.

shmalgyack: Mun hla'kiackshga hlgu awta da lack ggan
english: The porcupine climbed up the tree.

shmalgyack: Aam dm guulda hla'kods da gyalck
english: Hla meegt. It's time to gather the rhubarb outside. They're ripe.
Wow! My sister is very pretty.

shmalgyack: Lu'kwil wilaay wila gyoa 'yoota bite hlgooksh'nu ndm hoy'ant
english: That man knows what he doing and I can't do it like him.
My small child is very intelligent.

shmalgyack: Yagwan dsaba dm na'acka hlguhlgm noahlsh Kayla
english: I am making a dress for Kayla's doll.
The seagull has lots of eggs.
lu'kwil 'tsamaatgt gya'wn. People are looking for seagull eggs. It really tastes good now.
My little finger hurts.
I want to see my cousin.
That little child over there is always friendly.
That is the boy's father.
ahlgadee shm ggal aamhl wila load. Let's help these. They aren't doing well.
Wow! My wife sure knows how to make Indian bread.
My brother is hunting for black bear.
The car goes really fast on the road.

shmalgyack: Wie aam mdm hloada 'yoota, aam wila howd da 'kam
english: Well, we should respect the man, what he says is good.
My coworker got angry all of a sudden.
The water is deep where I'm going to swim.
My little grandchild is hiding from me.
I have a lot of in-laws now.
My father is eating fish.
I want new clothes.
My ankle hurts.
I smell smoke.
Throw the teacher a kiss.

shmalgyack: Hoo'bl dee wil gakshga na gga'dsaaw gyad
english: Some people are really awake at night.

shmalgyack: Ha'wahlgan dee nee wil gipaiga hou'ts I haven't seen the ducks fly
Gakshga hlguwoamhlg hlat tcka'noo na howsh noat
english: The child woke up when she heard her mother's voice.
Wear a belt, your pants are too big.
The woman sounds right.
The flower is beautiful.
I see how many things Tony can do.
My house is full of food.
It will be a full moon again tonight.
That cat's head is bleeding.
Ten people will eat.
There are fewer fish in the Nass River.

shmalgyack: Ahlgadee aamhl dm kshabatsga gga'bala da 'newalee
english: It's not good to have the gun stick out from the backpack.
They were naked on the beach.
Take out the soaking wet coat and hang it.
I want to run about when the moon comes out.
I was born in the summer.
The children were barefooted outside.
Tony went swimming naked.

shmalgyack: Ahl anoackanee ksha'dsal? Do you like half-dried fish?

english: We're going to wash nine plates.

shmalgyack: Kshdm'ashoal gyad gwin daawhld da Gitsgaan
english: Nine people went over to Ketchikan.

shmalgyack: Ksha kshdnshoal shaboo gyad dm leemeet
english: Only five people are going to sing.

shmalgyack: 'Tsuu hahlalsha kshdsood da wil loolgita gyad
english: The waiter worked hard where the people feasted.
Her tears ran when she got hurt.
We were happy when the man settled for the damages.
Nancy is first before me.

shmalgyack: Kshi'nag de hoyu hlan lu 'dsaicka wineaya da ggiehlu
english: I use my middle finger to lick out the bowl.
'tsa'tsiksht. Clean your shirt. It's dirty.

shmalgyack: Dm hoyu kshlushgm noak dsihla noakee
english: I'm going to wear a nightgown when I go to bed.

shmalgyack: Dm guuldm hoan dsihla kshuud deehl goamshm
english: We'll harvest fish in the fall and winter.
Dm luyeltgm hloula aam lacka. We're going to leave the village. We'll return while the weather's good.
I was startled when the man shot the gun.
I'm hungry.
Don't forget the knife.
I kicked the ball to the man there.

shmalgyack: Goahl shm anoacka gyad kwhlackshhla'at? Why do people really like football?
Shu mdm kwhleeggiackn na anaasha wun
english: You have to really scrape the deer hide.

shmalgyack: Kwhlee ggolggol boad da wil 'dsuu baashg
english: The wind tore the boat apart until it was gone.
My grandmother worked a long time when she pounded the seaweed.
The big rock that fell dented the car.
David knocked Dan out.
Hit the big fish, it's still alive.
The child's lips are funny when he's angry.
I'm going to buy five red buttons.

shmalgyack: Kw'dsag hoysh Kayla hlat goo hla'at
english: Kayla used a slingshot to shoot the ball.
Grass smells really good when it's cut.
We will leave at high tide.
I saw a worm under the rock.
That man is slow.
Don't buy alcohol.

shmalgyack: Shm ama goa laan, 'nee dm hoym hla goog hla'ashgm
english: Fish eggs are really good, that's what we'll use when we cook seaweed.
Let's all be of one heart.
Wrap up the box before you send it.

shmalgyack: Ahlgadee shguuhl dm labaalcka shila gyadn
english: You don't have to hate your fellow man.
I don't want to do something wrong.
Alec has large arm muscles.
Put the blanket upon the table.

shmalgyack: 'Kineetgu ashda gganhlaaga dowl lacka wil nee'etsgu ndm nee dsihla waash
english: When I woke up the other morning and I looked up to the sky to see if it would rain.

shmalgyack: Ahl tckanooynee goal dm wila waal Lackaga dsigi'dseeb? Have you heard what the weather is going to do tomorrow?

english: I can see the deer on the hill.
My husband belongs to the Wolf Clan.

shmalgyack: Lu'kwil hloa wila baa 'dsig'dsig a lack guyna
english: The car is going to fast on the road.

shmalgyack: Na 'yagayaam da lackhoo, nayaayu, gwinee'dsn da wil 'ken ha'dsalt, dowlt 'waad da lack loab
english: My grandfather and I walked down to the sandbar and he showed me where the devilfish was and we found it on the rock.
I belong to the Eagle Clan.
He/she is picking berries.
I get afraid when the waves on the ocean are big.

shmalgyack: Tckanooyu wil lack waalee magwa'ala hlaagigyad
english: I heard that old people had hard times.
Lay the firewood on the ground.
The tree is floating on the water.

shmalgyack: Wie dsa dup dsam lack'anaaym uua
english: Let's boil some ooligans in a pot.
Lets build a fire on the sandy beach.
'Nee dm goym. There are a lot of birds on the lake. That's where we're going.
Be careful on the barnacles.
Put the paper on the table.

shmalgyack: Na hla'kiackshgu da lack'oa waabu da goadsa wila waalu, ahlgadee da'ackgu dm tgiyaayu
english: I climbed on my roof and couldn't do anything, I wasn't able to get down.

shmalgyack: Ama needsa wila yaan da lack'U
english: You have to walk carefully on the muskeg.
Let's gather wood.
The woman is plucking her eyebrows.
I like herring eggs on hair kelp the best.

shmalgyack: 'Guul ganootg dm daawhlt nagoacka dm laguulgita gyad
english: People are supposed to wait one week before they burn.
My frying pan is burned inside.
The people were happy at the gathering.

shmalgyack: Ggal hailda shayb da la'uu, 'nee gn ahlgndee anoackt
english: There are too many bones in a trout, that's why I don't like it.

shmalgyack: Lebilt haaw hana'ack hlat tckanoo wil bee'ega hlguhlgt
english: The woman argued when she heard her child lie.
Wake up children.

shmalgyack: Hla dsudsu dowla leemeeym da Shm'oygit 'dsm lacka
english: We went to church and sang to God in Heaven.
There's a lot of animal fur on the highway.
Grouse meat is white.
The water drops on my eyeglasses are annoying.
Anyone will buy this.

shmalgyack: 'Gwaatga tcka'nee na liggiwaalsh Peda da 'dsm lag
english: All of Peter's belongings were lost in the house fire.
Either you or I will go to Ketchikan.
We come from a different village.
A different person sat by me.
giamga gyalck. Open the door. It's warm outside.
The island is where we plant potatoes.
Buy it yourself.

shmalgyack: Ahlgadee amooksha gyad dish 'need awil liphahawd
english: Nobody listens to her because she's ineffective.

shmalgyack: Liphown na algyacka Shm'oygit ga Lackaga awil dm ggatgyadn
english: Say the words of God to yourself so you will be strong.
The pastor preached the truth.

shmalgyack: Shiggene'etsga gyad da hana'ack hla lipnahowt
english: People stared at the woman when she talked to herself.
I'm going rub medicine on boil.
I almost fell down on the rock.
We know where the horse clam can be found.
We'll pick elderberries tomorrow.
We will wear a button blanket when there is a feast.

shmalgyack: Ahlgadeet naa en hoy loolp da sha gya'wn
english: Nobody uses fish traps today.

shmalgyack: Yagwat loonda hloadihla taggan awil dmt dsaba guyna
english: He's putting the planks together because he's making a path.
My mother is sewing a new coat.
You packed too many things with you.
I will meet you at the store.
I am tired in the afternoon.
I saw Doris hug the man.
Put the fish in the sack.
Put it into the closet.
Aam dm sha ggaboackm. The tide is low. Let's get some cockles.

shmalgyack: Hla lugwaantga dm wil yaawckga hlguwoamhlg
english: It's time for the little child to eat.

shmalgyack: Luhoa'N oomhl da 'koy? Will you fill the bucket for me?
Ahl shakshakshga na lukkwhleehoyyan? Are your underclothes clean?
Ggal gyamga hlguwoamhlg, 'nee gun ahlgadeet hoy lukhleekshlushg
english: The child was too warm, that's why he didn't wear an undershirt.
Wear underpants under your jeans.
She is washing her undergarments.

shmalgyack: Lu'kwil lup na waal hlaagi gyad
english: Our ancestors competed against each other.
The woman worried when her husband was lost.
I get worried when the wind is strong.
I'm returning to mothers.
She is sewing on her button blanket.
The woman was angry when the fire went out.
Put the pencil in the box.

shmalgyack: Lu'kwil ama ggoada 'yoota gwee dat 'gilm daala da 'koy
english: That man is very kind and he gave me money.
His wife found out what they were doing.

shmalgyack: Luwantga ggoada 'yoota hlat nee wil lu'wal ckshoa
english:
The man was worried when he saw that his canoe leaked.
